item.title: Single Packet, Single Channel, Switched Antenna Array for RF Localization
TomoID: A Scalable Approach to Device Free Indoor Localization via RFID Tomography

item.description: I’m a fourth year (yeah it’s taking a while) Ph.D. student at University of Michigan in Electrical and Computer Engineering, advised by Prof. Alanson Sample. I am a member of the Interactive Sensing and Computing Lab along with Yasha Iravantchi, Tom Krolikowski, Kunpeng Huang, Cameron Haire, and Yaxuan Li. (Shout out to former labmates Amani Alkayyali and Sumukh Marathe as well!) My research mainly focuses on RF sensing for indoor localization and/or human activity recognition.
